info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 12:22AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Lawrence, Crawford, northeastern Jasper and southwestern Clark Counties through 1245 AM CDT... At 1222 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Eaton, or 7 miles northwest of Robinson, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Robinson and Hardinville around 1240 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Palestine, Flat Rock and New Hebron. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for southeastern and east central Illinois.
